results.title: Deep-sea container ports
results.brief_description: “Summary: the first half of the film takes a general look at containerization and its impact on the ports, and on the international freight transport system, how it has streamlined and mechanized the system. the seco

results.title: Deen Maar: Past, Present & Future
results.brief_description: Geoff Clarke takes us on a tour of the Deen Maar property and explains why the island and the land is such a significant location for the local Indigenous people and is of importance to the Yambuk area. He discusses the challenge of incorporating modern industry on such a sensitive site, installing wind turbines on the land, which generates an economic return for the community while achieving a compromise in protecting the cultural significance of the site.

results.title: Decreasing inappropriate behaviours (TEFC): timeout
results.creator_credit: John Sucho and Macomb Community College Instructional Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Effective Behavioural Programming”.
Tape 4 : Timeout is a procedure in which positive reinforcement is withdrawn for a prespecified period of time following the performance of a misbehaviour. There are two types of timeout: exclusionary and non-exclusionary timeout. NB. This tape plays on 525 line NTSC

results.title: Decreasing inappropriate behaviours (TEFC): reinforcement procedure
results.creator_credit: John Socha and Macomb Community College Instructional Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Effective Behavioural Programming”.
Tape 4 : Discusses procedures for decreasing inappropriate behaviours within the least restrictive model of treatment. This model ranks the procedures according to their evasiveness, severity, and intrusiveness. When decreasing inappropriate behaviours, the teacher should only move to the next procedure if the current procedure is ineffective. NB. This videotape plays on 525 line NTSC
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Socha and Macomb Community College Instructional Television

results.title: Decreasing inappropriate behaviours (TEFC): physical restraint
results.creator_credit: John Socha and Macomb Community College Instructional Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Effective Behavioural Programming”.
Tape 5 : Discusses physical restraint and punishment programs. Teachers must be cautious in designing and implementing them because of their aversive nature. Both physical restraint and punishment have very powerful advantages, but they also have some serious drawbacks NB. This videotape is on 525 line NTSC

results.title: Decreasing inappropriate behaviours (TEFC): Overcorrection
results.creator_credit: John Socha and Macomb Community College Instructional Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Effective Behavioural Programming”.
Tape 7 : Overcorrection is a punishment procedure in which the misbehaving student is required to overcorrect the environmental effects of his misbehaviour (restitution) and to practice appropriate forms of behaviour in those situations where the misbehaviour commonly occurs (positive practice). NB. This videotape is on 525 line NTSC.

results.title: Deconstructing Harry. Mighty Aphrodite
results.brief_description: Mighty Aphrodite (1995): Writer-director Woody Allen plays Lenny, a sportswriter who is dissatisfied in his marriage to art dealer, Amanda. Lenny becomes obsessed with locating his adopted son’s natural mother, feeling convinced that she will be a brilliant and intelligent person. Instead she’s Linda, a ditzy porn star and prostitute. Despite the initial disillusionment, Lenny soon develops a fondness for Linda, and decides to help her get her life back on track. Cast includes: Woody Allen, Mira Sorvino, Helena Bonham Carter, Michael Rapaport, F. Murray Abraham, Olympia Dukakis and Peter Weller. Deconstructing Harry (1997): Harry (Woody Allen), a New York author, has just released his latest novel, “loosely” based on the characters from his own life - his ex-wives, mistresses, family and analysts. No-one likes his depiction of them, and in an hilariously ironic mixture of flashbacks to his new novel, flashbacks to his past, and mishaps in the present, the true story comes out. In classic Allen style, this autobiographical story is a fascinating mixture of fiction and reality. The cast is another line-up of characters in itself,including Kirstie Alley, Demi Moore, Robin Williams, Billy Crystal, Elisabeth Shue, Stanley Tucci, Amy Irving, Julie Kavner, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Mariel Hemingway and Judy Davis.

results.title: Deconstructed TV
results.brief_description: It’s hard to imagine, but television wasn’t always a 24/7/365 affair. TV stations used to stop broadcasting late at night when they ran out of programming. When off the air, they would commonly display a test pattern until the broadcast schedule resumed in the morning. Now television can be consumed free-to-air or whenever you want it thanks to on-demand and streaming services. This deconstructed TV was a National brand model, the kind of appliance mass produced in the 1970s. Today families are less likely to gather around a single TV set, instead favouring their own fractured shards of screen content

constellations_other.name: Nightly news and laughs
constellations_other.description: Throughout the decades on Australian screens, comedy and news have often gone hand-in-hand.
